events.text:
[i]Against the wall lies the telephone switchboard, allowing for everyone’s calls to be redirected and get to the right part of the building.[/i]
[i]It’s in a sorry state, broken lights and split wires displayed for nobody to see.[/i]
[i]Unless it’s fixed, no telephone calls are coming in or out.[/i]

[Dream - Medium] [i]There’s someone waiting to make a call.[/i]
[i]Someone in a forgotten room. They’re waiting to put in the number and reach the next operator.[/i]
[i] The only sound being the dial tone mixed with their steady breathing.[/i]
[i]Growing excited to say the words that will lead to another broken switchboard and white sheet.[/i]

[i]He certainly did a number on the device.[/i]
[i]The smaller bits and pieces are all over the panels.[/i]
[i]Switches are missing and the small light bulbs have been smashed, covering the floor with tiny shards of glass.[/i]

[Perception - Medium] [i]You would assume something like this would have to be done with a hammer or wrench or some other tool, but there’s nothing in here that would fit that description.[/i]
[i]There’s nothing in the room that looks like it could have helped breaking it.[/i]
[i]There’s no way he did this with his hands, is there?[/i]
[i]This looks like a tough fix, but it’s doable.[/i]

events.choice: [Logic - Hard]  Attempt to fix the switchboard

events.text: [PASS] Shit. No. Wait, what if…fuck, no. No. No. None of this works.

[i]You’ve severely underestimated the extent of the damages.[/i]
[i]There are so many missing pieces that cannot be easily replaced with what you have on hand that the idea of it working again anytime soon is laughable.[/i]
[i]It would be easier to scrap the entire thing and get a replacement, in your opinion.[/i]
[i]You should just stop wasting your time with this junk pile and start looking elsewhere.[/i]
[FAIL] Let’s see. Just need to reattach these two wires here, place a switch there…
[i]Beautiful. If not for the lightbulbs that still need replacing, you would say it looks brand new. Everything in its place. Phone calls will come rolling back in no time.[/i]
[i]Phone: *ring*[/i]

events.question: [i]Ah! There’s someone trying to get a call in now. It must be another part of the building. Maybe you should answer it, let them know the telephones should be operational again.[/i]

events.text: [i]You pick the phone off the receiver.[/i]
Hello?
[i]There’s nothing. Not even the dial tone.[/i]
[i]Was the switchboard still broken?[/i]
Hello? Hey, is this thing working?
[i]A voice! You’ve done it.[/i]
I can hear you just fine.
This is the station out near Tonopah. What the hell happened over there? We’ve been trying to send calls down west for hours.
There was an incident which left our switchboard out of commision, but I’ve managed to get it under control.
A busted up switchboard? Damn, we’re lucky it didn’t take the whole day for y’all to fix it up. Mighty impressive job to get done in a few hours.
Honestly, it feels like it only took maybe 20 minutes.
No kidding? With skills like that, how is it you’re working here in Roadtown and not over at Edison or something?

[i]You know exactly why.[/i]
[i]You could have done that.[/i]
[i]You could have made all the money you would ever need.[/i]

[i]You could be out there instead of this slum house.[/i]
[i]There were good schools lined up for you.[/i]
[i]A promising future.[/i]

events.question:
[i]And then it all went to shit.[/i]
[i]You can’t even blame it on the Crash.[/i]
[i]You know *exactly* who to blame.[/i]

events.choice: [Composure - Impossible] Calm down and hang up

events.text:
[PASS] [i]...[/i]
[i]You hang the phone back on the receiver.[/i]
[i]You should find something to do before you start to cry.[/i]

[FAIL] [i]It’s because of *her*.[/i]
[i]She promised you she would help you. That she would help cover the costs. That your future was just as important to her as it was to you.[/i]

[i]And instead she pissed all that money away on liquor and suitors.[/i]
[i]Crying every night about how she just wanted to run away and leave all her problems behind.[/i]

[i]The unspoken words being how *you* were one of them.[/i]
[i]And then she did. She left you with *nothing*. With *less than nothing*. You couldn’t go to school anymore. You had to take shit job after shit job, clinging to every scrap you could get your hands on.[/i]

[i]She didn’t even say goodbye. All she left you was hate.[/i]
[i]…[/i]
[i]It’s all ruined.[/i]
[i]Everything.[/i]

[i]And you have to settle for this now.[/i]
[i]…[/i]

[i]You don’t even put the phone back on the receiver. You just let it hang.[/i]
[i]There’s nothing for you to do.[/i]
[i]Even the hate has died for you.[/i]
